title: Elections 2016: East of England results and reaction - BBC News
summary: coverage of the 2016 english local council elections in the east of england .
elections were taking place in 25 local authorities across the east region .
currently 12 councils are in conservative control , five are labour and eight have no overall control .
the local elections are quite separate from the eu referendum on 23 june .

documents.title: election 2016 : that 's it for our east live page now over to local live
text: that 's it for our overnight live coverage .
we 'll now hand over to local live for more reaction and also results from the police and crime commissioner elections that are due to be declared later .
this report from ian barmer sums up the situation in the east .

documents.title: conservatives still main force in east
text: the conservatives are still the main party of local government across the east of england , they run the majority of our councils , they have the largest number of councillors .
they made the only gain of the night - taking peterborough out of no overall control .

but the party will be disappointed that it failed to take colchester , lost its only seat on cambridge city council and , despite a lot of effort , failed to get any councillors back on to the local council in norwich .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: ukip gains from labour
text: though labour in general will be pleased by its showing in the local elections in the east , ukip made major inroads in its support in great yarmouth , basildon and thurrock .
in those council elections , ukip once again proved that it can command significant support at the expense of labour .
in great yarmouth , ukip is now the second the largest party on the borough council and will probably help run the authority in alliance with the conservatives .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: conservatives hold ward after by-election in waveney
text: one by-election was held at conservative-controlled waveney district council after a resignation .
it was no change in the wrentham ward , which stayed blue :
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: mixed for lib dems in the east
text: the liberal democrats are still in play in the east .
they will once again run colchester borough council , albeit in alliance with labour and they have an increased presence on the newly re-drawn peterborough authority .
but it 's a mixed they lost seats in both cambridge and southend .
the greens now face a major problem .
after a decade of almost unstoppable success , their loss of four seats in one night on norwich city council will hurt and they did n't make any gains any where else .
it is clear that labour 's move to the left is winning back former labour supporters .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: conservatives remain in control of welwyn hatfield
text: the conservatives remain in control of welwyn hatfield council where all the seats were up for grabs due to boundary changes .
the tories lost one seat as did three independents while the liberal democrats gained three and labour gained one .
results from handside conclude proceedings here in wgc

documents.title: football legend peter shilton joins fiancee at election count
text: england international goalkeeper peter shilton made an appearance at the colchester borough council election in support of his fiancee stephanie hayward .
unfortunately for the couple , ms hayward did not win the seat she was contesting .

documents.title: labour relief at results in east
text: labour will be waking up this morning mightily relieved .
there were real fears last night among supporters that the party would lose seats across the east .
but in its traditional heartlands labour 's vote held up and it also made several impressive gains .
supporters of jeremy corbyn are already saying that this proves that the new labour leader has what it takes to win parliamentary seats in the east .
the mp for norwich south clive lewis told the bbc this morning that mr corbyn 's critics should `` shut up or get out '' .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: milton keynes conservative leader says 'corbyn visit did it '
text: the conservative group leader on milton keynes council edith bald says the labour voters may have been galvanised by a recent visit from party leader jeremy corbyn after the party ended up with the same number of seats on the council as the conservatives .
she said : `` we did recently have over 600 people attend a corbyn rally in milton keynes which i think backs up my feeling . ''
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: no overall control
text: lots of councils in the east have found themselves with no one party in overall control .
in these circumstances two or more parties may form a coalition or some form of loose agreement .
another option is for the largest party to run the authority as a minority administration .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: milton keynes labour leader says it 's 'always been close '
text: the milton keynes labour group leader pete marland has said it 's `` always been close '' in the town after his party ended up with the same number of seats on the council as the conservatives .
he said it was a `` really good night '' for the milton keynes labour group as a whole as they held off a conservative challenge .
he said : `` the conservatives were sure they were going to get a majority , they have n't , and actually i think what a majority of people in milton keynes have shown .
is that there 's a progressive majority in the city that want a fairer milton keynes , a more progressive milton keynes and want a more affordable milton keynes . ''
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: colchester remains in no overall control
text: colchester borough council remains with no party in overall control following the local elections .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: england legend 's fiancee fails to get on election scoresheet
text: peter shilton 's fiancee stephanie hayward has failed in her bid to become a colchester councillor .
ms hayward , who lives on mersea island and featured on saturday live on bbc radio 4 recently , was standing as a conservative in the highwoods ward .
the seat was won by the independent gerard oxford .

documents.title: son not like father
text: earlier we mentioned that ben williams was hoping to succeed his father geoff williams as a liberal democrat councillor in basildon .
however , when the ballot papers were counted for the nethergate ward , it seems voters decided not to keep it in the family as they went for derrick fellowes of ukip .
basildon council remains with no single party in overall control , but the conservatives are the largest party with 18 out of a total of 42 councillors .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: making sense of the night before
text: look east producer ian barmer is busy editing together for this morning 's look east bulletins .
the main headline so far ?
not a lot has changed .

documents.title: the sun is rising and the counts go on
text: but some local council election counts are still continuing , including in colchester .
this is our view from the norwich newsroom which features the st peter mancroft in the foreground and the spire of norwich cathedral in the distance .

documents.title: council colours across the east of england
text: there are still some results still to come across the east region , but so far the only change in control is in peterborough which has gone from overall control to a conservative majority .

documents.title: milton keynes round-up : council remains in no overall control
text: it 's been a night of small surprises here in milton keynes , with labour losing one seat to the liberal democrats and therefore ending up with the same number of seats as the conservatives - both parties now have 22 seats and the liberal democrats have 13 .

it means that for the moment , labour 's peter marland stays in charge and that is unlikely to change unless there 's some serious discussion in the next few days but i think both parties felt they could do better - indeed the conservatives were hoping to take full control .
labour , though , might be feeling a little bit more relieved that they did n't lose more seats and at the end of it they still are running the council for the time being .
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: labour make four gains from the greens in norwich
text: it 's been a successful night for labour in norwich as the party retained control of the city council , making four gains from the greens in the process .
thirteen out of 39 seats were up for grabs , resulting in the parties with the following totals :

documents.title: at the scene : 'the tensions were palpable '
text: the tensions at the backstage centre in purfleet were palpable .
just when the final declaration seemed imminent it went to a third recount and even more nail biting , it was squeaky bum time .
thurrock was a top target for ukip on a national basis and in the end they fell agonisingly short in coming out level with the conservatives .
nonetheless , they 're jubilant at having up six seats , which the leader graham snell puts down to his colleagues hard work on local issues such as housing , jobs and the environment .
author: Jonathan Josephs
BBC News

documents.title: conservatives hold broxbourne
text: the conservatives remain in control of broxbourne borough council , gaining two seats from independents .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stevenage remains under labour control
text: stevenage borough council remains under labour control despite the conservatives gaining a seat .
here is the make-up of the new council , where a third of the seats were being contested - turnout was nearly 35 % :
turn out for # stevenage # localelections was 34.65 % turn out for # hertspcc2016 in # stevenage was 34.20 %
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the dust is settling thurrock
text: the conservatives and ukip will have to find a way to work together after both parties each gained 17 seats .
judging by this photograph of both local party leaders , it looks a fairly harmonious start .
jonathan josephs
jonathanjosephs
1st photo new joint leaders of @ twitterid # tory & # ukip confident they can work together .
17 each .
# thurrock
1st photo new joint leaders of @ twitterid # tory & # ukip confident they can work together .
17 each .
# thurrock

documents.title: st albans remains under conservative control
text: a third of the seats on st albans city and district council were up for grabs with the conservatives remaining in control having gained one seat .
the liberal democrats also gained a seat while labour lost one and there was also an independent loss .
the green party councillor simon grover was re-elected for st peter 's ward after a re-count .
here is the make-up of the new council :
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: labour leader set to stay on at noc milton keynes
text: it looks likely that labour leader will stay on in charge at milton keynes council until at least the authority 's agm later this month , following the election results leaving no one party in overall control .
labour and the conservatives have 22 seats each after labour lost one seat to the lib dems .
the lib dems have 13 seats .
there is talk of coalition but labour could end up running council .
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: scores on the doors in daventry
text: here 's the final round-up from the daventry council count , courtesy of bbc northampton political reporter sam read .
all results in .
cons lose 1 seat to lab .
12 seats up tonight : 8 cons , 3 lab , 1 ld .
overall council now : 30 cons , 3 lab , 2 ukip & 1 ld .
@ twitterid chris long lost his seat in abbey north to ken ritchie .

documents.title: great yarmouth remains in no overall control
text: despite ukip gaining four seats at great yarmouth borough council , the local authority remains in a situation where no single party has overall control , but the conservatives are running the administration .
thirteen out of 39 seats were up for grabs and ukip made all of its gains at the expense of labour .
that leaves the parties with the following totals :
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: breakingconservatives win control of peterborough
text: conservatives have gained peterborough city council from no overall control .

documents.title: breakingtories hold daventry
text: conservative have retained control of daventry council .

documents.title: so many colours to choose from and we do n't mean a political party
text: ever wondered what goes on behind the scenes during the bbc east television election bulletins in the wee small hours of the morning ?
it seems that a sugar rush is what it takes to keep things running smoothly .

documents.title: ipswich a red dot in a sea of blue
text: suffolk is overwhelmingly conservative with seven out of seven tory mps , but ipswich borough council looks like it will remain a red dot in a sea of blue .
labour has held its seats in the alexandra , whitehouse , priory heath , bridge , gainsborough and st john 's wards and made a gain from the conservatives in sprites ward .
author: Felicity Simper
BBC Look East

documents.title: ukip beating labour on the norfolk coast
text: great yamouth borough council had had no single party in overall control and that 's looking like it will remain the case , but the conservatives are holding seats , while labour is losing out to ukip .
ukip make 4 gains in great yarmouth and are now main opposition
@ twitterid the people 's army marches on .

documents.title: neck and neck in milton keynes
text: both labour and the tories are now predicting milton keynes council will be hung , with both parties on 22 seats .
before yesterday 's vote , labour had 23 seats - one more than the conservatives .
this would still be a bad result for the tories who had hoped to overtake and become the biggest party , but labour 's vote has held up well with very high turnout in labour areas .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: labour needs to do more against tories , says mp
text: with no elections at luton borough council , luton south 's labour mp gavin shuker has been at the count in peterborough , where the conservatives were holding on to their seats .
he said : `` in the places where we 're making gains it 's against the greens and liberals .
`` we need to make gains against the conservatives . ''

documents.title: breakinglabour hold cambridge
text: labour have retained control of cambridge city council

documents.title: breakinglabour hold norwich
text: labour have retained control of norwich city council .

documents.title: more ukip gains in norfolk
text: ukip is making progress at great yamouth borough council , where no single party has overall control , but the conservatives are running the administration .
more great yarmouth election results .
labour holds southtown and cobholm , ukip takes central and northgate from labour .
lab holds st andrews

documents.title: parties discuss control of thurrock council
text: the future control of thurrock council is being looked at following the major gains by ukip and the labour losses .
ukip and the conservatives both have 17 seats , while labour , which had been the largest party , now only has 14 seats .
there is also one independent .
the council remains an authority where no one party has overall control .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: somebody ? anybody ? daventry returning officer seeks an audience
text: northampton political reporter sam read is among them .
returning officer trying to coax some more people to come and hear the results announced in this room .

documents.title: watch : the moment labour councillor held yarmouth seat
text: results are coming in thick and fast now .
this is the moment when michael jeal retained nelson ward for labour in great yarmouth in norfolk .

documents.title: labour holds seat in suffolk
text: only one council in suffolk has elections this week .
labour-run ipswich borough council has notched up a victory in one of the wards
another lab hold in ipswich for bridge award # le2016
author: Felicity Simper
BBC Look East

documents.title: ukip 's results 'very strong '
text: ukip 's peter reeve , of cambridgeshire county council , told look east : `` in the east of england we are showing a very strong set of results .
ukip is the party of the future . ''

documents.title: essex mp says conservative support has held up
text: harlow mp robert halfon has been at the count at the town 's council and says the tories have done well across the country .
@ halfon4harlowmp tells @ twitterid it 's actually been a good night for the tories .

documents.title: milton keynes : first seat to change hands so far tonight
text: labour has lost a seat at milton keynes council , where it runs things as the largest party , but does not have overall control .
# miltonkeynes bradwell ward lib dem gain from lab first seat to change hands so far tonight
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: labour win 'closely fought ' milton keynes seat
text: labour have just held one of the most closely fought seats on milton keynes council and are now suggesting they could remain the largest party on the council , where no party has overall control .
a net loss of just one seat to the conservatives would see the tories become the largest group , but labour sources are suggesting they might have held off that challenge .
labour 's win was in the stony stratford ward , where there was a massive 41 % turnout , which indicates both parties have done a good job of getting their vote out in the contested wards .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: ukip predicting more gains on the norfolk coast
text: kay grey , the ukip group leader at great yarmouth borough council , was predicting winning four seats , although one of them , nelson ward , has already been held by labour .
meanwhile , the conservative group leader graham plant is confident he will hold on to four seats and is hoping to gain two .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lower turnout for cambridge local elections
text: this is from bbc cambridgeshire reporter julia greenaway .
turnout at # cambridge local elections down on 2015 when it was 58.8 % .
2016 was 40.1 % @ twitterid

documents.title: ukip wins first seat in great yarmouth in this year 's election
text: the uk independence party has won its first seat ( from labour ) in this year 's vote on great yarmouth borough council .
labour has held two seats ; the conservatives two .
the council had no overall control before this year 's vote , but it was run by a tory administration .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: conservative vote holding up in thurrock
text: the conservative vote has been holding up in most wards in the thurrock council elections which may help the party join ukip with 17 seats apiece .
labour has definitely lost its status as the biggest party on this unitary authority and is set to have 14 seats on the new council .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: labour holds two seats in norfolk
text: labour has held the first two seats to be declared at great yarmouth borough council , with victories in the magdalen and nelson wards .
however , the group leader trevor wainwright predicts he could lose three seats to ukip and fail to win back an independent seat .
the council is currently run by a conservative administration , although no party has overall control .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: the east councils up for election with no overall control ahead of the counts
text: the east councils up for election with no overall control ahead of the counts

documents.title: lib dems lose last seat at essex council
text: the liberal democrats have no-one left at basildon council after defeat in the nethermayne ward .
before thursday 's vote , the local authority was run by a conservative administration , but they did not have overall control .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: this is how southend-on-sea borough council now looks
text: southend-on-sea bc
southendbc
council under no overall control : con -24 ( +2 ) lab -10 ( +1 ) ind -9 lib dem -2 ( -2 ) southend ind group -3 ukip -2 non aligned ind -1 ( -1 )
council under no overall control : con -24 ( +2 ) lab -10 ( +1 ) ind -9 lib dem -2 ( -2 ) southend ind group -3 ukip -2 non aligned ind -1 ( -1 )

documents.title: labour leader hoping to 2016 is better than 2015
text: one seat to watch in ipswich is that of labour leader of the borough council david ellesmere , who is up for re-election in his gipping ward .
he was last year 's labour candidate for the general election in ipswich , but lost to the conservative ben gummer , who retained the seat he won from labour in 2010 .
along with mr ellesmere , the deputy council leader bryony rudkin and cabinet member carole jones are up for re-election .
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk political reporter

documents.title: labour vote holding up in three towns across the east
text: talk of labour doing badly in the east may be premature .
its vote seems to be holding up in ipswich , harlow and stevenage .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: banana drama in ipswich
text: to eat or not to eat ?
that 's the question look east 's felicity simper is grappling with right now in ipswich .
felicity simper
felicitysimper
i fear i 've peaked too soon and eaten my banana too early # le2016
i fear i 've peaked too soon and eaten my banana too early # le2016
@ twitterid chocolate resort to chocolate ; -p
@ twitterid i would if i had some !
@ twitterid i 've got loads in my fridge but i believe you 're in ipswich ! ! !
you may have keeled over before i get there ; - )

documents.title: now a look at ipswich and the count goes on and on
text: the ipswich count and they 're still counting

documents.title: southend stays in no overall control
text: southend council will remain with no one party in overall control ,
the election saw the conservatives gain two seats .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: ukip could take control of thurrock
text: there is a big story emerging in thurrock council , where ukip have taken six seats so far .
the party looks like they will be largest party on council .
ukip have taken seats from everyone - four from labour , one from the conservatives and one from the independents .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: ipswich 'not expecting big upset '
text: on to ipswich borough council now , which has been labour for decades apart from a spell between 2004 until 2011 , when there was no overall control .
labour started the night with 31 out of 48 seats , so , with a third of seats up for election with one by-election , we 're not expecting a big upset .
it 'll take labour losing all their seats to the conservatives as well as the tories holding on to their own to see a change of hands at ipswich borough .
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk political reporter

documents.title: first result at milton keynes
text: the first result at milton keynes council sees labour hold the central ward with 1,327 votes against the tories ' 680 votes .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: ukip on course in thurrock
text: this is what ukip have been saying in thurrock , where they are on course to win five seats and become the largest party .
we have every reason to be optimistic that we will make a solid five gains and there will be more surprises along the way .

documents.title: ukip take four seats on thurrock council
text: ukip have now won four of the five seats they predicted they would win on thurrock council in essex - two from labour , one from the conservatives and one from an independent .
the party is on course to become the largest party on the council .
no party was in overall control at the council after the last local elections , with labour having 18 councillors , the conservatives 17 , ukip 11 and independents three .
labour formed a minority administration .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: breakinglabour hold harlow
text: news just in from essex political reporter simon dedman , who reveals labour have clung on to harlow council .

documents.title: lib dem fears over colchester
text: we 're turning our attention to colchester now , where the liberal democrats have run the borough council for most of the last 30 years .

but following the party 's mauling in the general election , which saw the town 's mp sir bob russell ( and with the borough boundaries being completely re-drawn , it is very possible that the party will lose control to the conservatives .
if this happens it will be a major blow for a party which once described itself as the main opposition in the east .
the lib dems once had more than 500 councillors in our region , now it 's down to just over 200 - will they fall further ?
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: breakinglabour hold council in hertfordshire
text: labour has held stevenage borough council .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: breakingukip make further gains at thurrock
text: ukip have taken two more seats on thurrock council , one from labour and one from the conservatives .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: live on facebook from milton keynes
text: look east political reporter tom barton is live on the look east facebook page right now , taking us behind the scenes at the election count in milton keynes .
you can watch here .

documents.title: high ( political ) drama in essex
text: look east reporter gareth george is at the harlow count - and is clearly gripped by the occasion .
gareth george
garethjgeorge
amidst the compelling political drama , time for my thermos of hot chocolate and a flapjack
amidst the compelling political drama , time for my thermos of hot chocolate and a flapjack
@ twitterid @ twitterid matchsticks for the eyelids yet ?

documents.title: breakingconservatives hold castle point
text: another result just in and it 's another conservative hold - this time at castle point council in essex .

documents.title: breakingconservative hold essex council
text: conservatives have held brentwood council in essex .

documents.title: line drawn under pen crisis
text: austerity at peterborough city council appears not to have reached the stationery department .
our bbc reporter lost her green pen earlier but she wants to highlight her hosts ' generosity
woohoo !
our excellent hosts @ twitterid have found me a replacement .
carry on everyone # le2016

documents.title: a recap on where we currently stand with labour in the east
text: these are our the labour controlled councils .

documents.title: breakingukip take second seat at thurrock
text: ukip have won a second ward in thurrock with 48 % of the vote .
the party has taken the tilbury st chads seat from labour .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: pen friends or not ?
text: hannah olsson , reporting from the peterborough city council count , has lost one of her all-important highlighter pens .
she 's pointing the finger at a fellow journalist from the peterborough telegraph , in jest one assumes .
we 've got an emergency at the # peterborough count.someone has stolen my green highlighter .
was it you @ twitterid ?
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: police commissioner voter turnout up in cambridgeshire
text: voter turnout in the police and crime commissioner election looks like it 's up in cambridgeshire , if figures from two council areas reflect the wider
fenland and east cambs councils are reporting an 18 % turnout , which compares to 14.8 % for the whole county when sir graham bright won the new post for the conservatives in 2012 .
sir graham ( standing for re-election .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: breakingukip take seat at thurrock
text: ukip has taken a seat from an independent candidate on thurrock council .
luke spillman won the aveley and and upland ward .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: ukip hopes to to become major force in thurrock
text: ukip are expecting to make major inroads at thurrock council which could see it becoming the largest party .
graham snell , leader of the group on the council , said the party expected to take three to five seats .
if the party took the seats from labour or the conservatives , it would become either the largest or second largest political group .
diane james , deputy chairman of ukip , told bbc essex : `` it is going to be a good evening .
ukip is campaigning on mainstream issues . ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: green party expects to lose seats on norwich city council
text: the green party expects to lose seats on norwich city council , party activists have told bbc radio norfolk .
the party has five seats up for election this year .
activists have told the bbc they expect to lose one or two council seats .
not that long ago they were competing for control of the council .
author: Bob Carter
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: breakinganother conservative hold
text: this time it 's in hertfordshire , where the tories have held on to power at broxbourne borough council .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: cambridgeshire 's local election battlegrounds
text: there are some interesting battlegrounds in cambridgeshire in 2016 .

we 'll be watching peterborough closely to see if the conservative 's can get enough support to regain control , the whole council is up for election there because of boundary changes , and no one seems sure what effect that 'll have .
elsewhere , labour will be hoping to cling on to control in cambridge .

the party may have won the day there in the general election , but they only have a small majority in the city council and it 'll be interesting to see how events in the labour party nationally will affect their share of the vote here .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter
